title: What are the stages of innovation? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are many ways to define innovation, and there are many ways to define “steps”, and there are many many steps. Innovation is inventions that are bought by buyers. The buy indicate the disruption and value. No purchase, no innovation.  For an “inventive person”, here are the four steps. Step 1: get into business mindset; Step 2: get into market; Step 3: find opportunity; Step 4; spend your own money and make the product and bring it to market.  There are another alternative four step if someone is doing it on his/her own and really getting into business/company: Step 1: find target audience; Step 2: find what value to provide; Step 3: make the offering and test if the value is accepted; Step 4: if yes, build a company to grow the business.

The phases of an innovation, i.e an innovation process, can be divided into four main steps: Idea: collection of innovation potentials, derivation of ideas, evaluation and release of ideas.Concept: Extensive analysis and derivation of concepts for the solution, implementation and marketing.Solution: Development and testing of the solutions to the finished product.Market: Arouse and fulfill a customer's needs by implementing in procurement, production and logistics as well as marketing and sales.
